comment: I really like this whiskey. It has a fairly mellow, but smooth flavor on the nose. The taste is similarly smooth with a great deal of that rye spiciness. The finish is a little thin, but without much bite. A higher-proof bottling of Heaven’s Door rye would be interesting, but this version is very good.

Notes of spice and a Bouquet of cherries hit my nose at first smell. As I taste the first thing that comes to mind in chocolate cherry brownies. Very smooth and sweet whiskey. Is definitely a unique whiskey thats worth a try.
Very nice caramel nose. Quite different for a rye but very smooth and quite pleasant. Will definitely buy again.
At Mark’s ... Tobacco, cinnamon, oak, hot.
Undrinkable. Bob Dylan should've tasted this before investing millions of dollars into a trash rye product!!
Spicy aroma and flavor with some green notes.
For a Rye it is smooth without much rye burn. There is a tiny hint of the  nail polish alcohol in the pallet but very approachable.
Sweet vanilla up front with clove after.

Nose: spice, lemon peel, vanilla.
Palate: very spicy, cinnamon, a bit of oak; warming. Finish is long and spicy.
Water: balances the nose and tames the palate.
Overall: perfect for a lover of spicy ryes, with a variety of other interesting flavors.
